data.body: Given a name $S$. Print "Hello, (name)" without parentheses.

editorial_code.code:
```python
```python
import sys
from sys import stdin, stdout

def main():
    data = stdin.read().split()
    idx = 0
    s = data[idx]
    idx += 1
    stdout.write("Hello, " + s + "\n")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```
```

hints.hint1: Consider how to read a string from the input.
hints.hint2: Read the name from the input and print "Hello, " followed by the name.
hints.solution_approach:
To solve this problem, read the input string $S$ using the appropriate input method. Then, print "Hello, " concatenated with $S$.

Time Complexity per test case: $O(1)$

data.input_format: Only one line containing a string $S$.
data.note: In each sample input, a name is provided. The program outputs "Hello, " followed by the provided name.
data.output_format: Print "Hello, " without quotes, then print name.
data.title: Say Hello With C++
